title.narrative: Broiler farm management training South Sulawesi (Part 1)

description.narrative: With selective training and relatively small-scale investments in stall equipment (closed water, heating and ventilation systems), open house broiler farmers in South Sulawesi can be trained and shown how to improve the operations of their activities and realise better (financial) results.This approach has been successfully implemented in a previous K2K training project on broiler farm management in West-Java, as executed under the FTI (RVO project reference K2K14IND03). Via this ongoing training programme, so far over 15 farm managers and 70 farm employees of 8 mid-sized Indonesian broiler farms and several extension workers of ASOHI in West-Java have successfully been trained.The success of this training programme in West-Java raised the interest of other regions in Indonesia, hence the ambition to provide a training program for broiler farm managers in South-Sulawesi. Thanks to the lessons learned and built-up relationships, the project team will be able to operate highly efficiently. For example: The curriculum of the previous training programme is already developed and translated in Bahasa Indonesia and can be adapted to local circumstances with minimum efforts.The short term objectives of this project are:1. Increased knowledge level amongst selected South-Sulawesi open house broiler farm managers (20-30) directly and their farm staff (100-300) indirectly. Focus topics include:• Stall equipment (water systems, heating and ventilation).• Applied management (brooding management, monitoring of flock, litter management).2. Lower mortality ratio amongst poultry flocks, resulting in increased animal welfare, higher efficiency and lower production costs on selected farms.3. Knowledge transfer between the project partners, particularly local beneficiaries / supporting parties Dinas Peternakan and ASOHI.4. Showing representatives of Dinas Peternakan and ASOHI the effects of the training and small-scale equipment investments.The long term objectives of this project are:1. Increased knowledge level on broiler farm management (animal diseases, risk factors and stall equipment) within the South-Sulawesi poultry sector.2. Better management practices amongst South-Sulawesi open house broiler farmers, contributing to better financial results of farmers, less health risk and better animal welfare.3. Increased usage of modern stall equipment (closed water systems, heating and ventilation) in South-Sulawesi’s poultry sector.4. Increased awareness of modern Dutch stall equipment resulting in improved positioning of Dutch companies (e.g. export possibilities).
